required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study for the Effects of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation on the Brain Using an Electronic Medical Device
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study for the Effects of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation on the Brain Using an Electronic Medical Device: A Single Institution, Randomized, Double-blind, Sham-controlled Study Using Multimodal Neuroimaging in Healthy Young Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized, double-blind, and sham-controlled trial to examine the effects of transcranial magnetic stimulation on the brain of health individuals.

detailed_description.textblock: The efficacy of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation on the brain will be assessed by multimodal neuroimaging in healthy individuals.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolic brain changes in magnetic resonance imaging by computational approaches

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional brain changes in magnetic resonance imaging by computational approaches
Standardized scores on a neuropsychological test battery

arm_group.description: Five consecutive daily repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation sessions (Neurostar TMS Therapy System, NeuroStar XPLOR System) Two weeks wash-out period Five consecutive daily sham stimulation sessions

Five consecutive daily sham stimulation sessions (Neurostar TMS Therapy System, NeuroStar XPLOR System) Two weeks wash-out period Five consecutive daily repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation sessions

intervention.intervention_name: Neurostar TMS Therapy System, NeuroStar XPLOR System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 19-39 years
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- High fever patient
- Current and past history of seizure or epilepsy
- Evidence of epilepsy on EEG
- Pregnancy or possibility of pregnancy during period
- Major medical or neurological illnesses
- Evidence of alcohol intake on alcohol breath test
- Contraindications to MRI scans and transcranial magnetic stimulation
- Risk of skin burns
- Use of medications that could have influenced on the study
